user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SetLocalTime_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_SetLocalTime_Impl(const OS_time_t *time_struct)
{
    int             Status;
    int32           ReturnCode;
    struct timespec TimeSp;

    TimeSp.tv_sec  = OS_TimeGetTotalSeconds(*time_struct);
    TimeSp.tv_nsec = OS_TimeGetNanosecondsPart(*time_struct);

    Status = clock_settime(OSAL_GETTIME_SOURCE_CLOCK, &TimeSp);

    if (Status == 0)
    {
        ReturnCode = OS_SUCCESS;
    }
    else
    {
        ReturnCode = OS_ERROR;
    }

    return ReturnCode;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_SetLocalTime_Impl:
static inline int64 OS_TimeGetTotalSeconds(OS_time_t tm)
{
    return (tm.ticks / OS_TIME_TICKS_PER_SECOND);
}
...
static inline uint32 OS_TimeGetNanosecondsPart(OS_time_t tm)
{
    return (uint32)OS_TimeGetFractionalPart(tm) * OS_TIME_TICK_RESOLUTION_NS;
}
...
int32 OS_SetLocalTime(const OS_time_t *time_struct)
{
    /* Check parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(time_struct);

    return OS_SetLocalTime_Impl(time_struct);
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
OS_CHECK_POINTER(time_struct);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The OS_CHECK_POINTER(time_struct) is a parameter-check macro and does not call OS_SetLocalTime or OS_SetLocalTime_Impl, so there is no direct or indirect recursion. A violation would occur if OS_CHECK_POINTER expanded to call back into OS_SetLocalTime (or into a function that eventually called OS_SetLocalTime), which would create indirect recursion, but that is not the case here.
